Name: Baby Carriages and Strollers Allowed While Shopping
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring retail establishments to allow persons with baby carriages or strollers to enter and shop in such establishments.
Text:
Int No. 499

By Council Members McCaffery, Duane and Koslowitz; also Council Members Espada, Lasher and Marshall.

..Title
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring retail establishments to allow persons with baby carriages or strollers to enter and shop in such establishments.
.. Body

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Chapter one of title 10 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding thereto a new section 10-161 to read as follows:

      � 10-161 Admission of baby carriages to retail establishments. It shall be unlawful for an owner of a retail establishment or a servant, agent or employee of an owner, to prohibit a person pushing a baby carriage or stroller from entering such retail establishment with such carriage or stroller or from shopping at such retail establishment with such carriage or stroller, unless the presence of such carriage or stroller would violate any fire safety codes or regulations.  Any person who shall violate or refuse to comply with the provisions of this section shall, upon conviction thereof, be punished by a fine of not more than one hundred.
      � 2.  This local law shall take effect immediately.
